title: LieCMS: A Flow Size Measurement Framework Based on Lie Group Means Learning
venue: 2025 International Conference on Sensor-Cloud and Edge Computing System (SCECS)
abstract: Network traffic measurement is a critical function for network management and optimization, providing essential insights for load balancing, congestion control, routing, and Quality of Service. However, due to network devicesâ€™ limited memory resources, existing measurement methods typically adopt a counter-sharing strategy, where all flows are mixed and measured together. Such a strategy leads to hash collisions and introduces significant noise that severely impacts accuracy. To address this issue, We propose LieCMS, a flow size measurement framework based on Lie group mean learning, which improves measurement accuracy by identifying and correcting flows susceptible to noise. LieCMS consists of on-chip recording and offchip learning. The on-chip component uses Count-Min Sketch (CMS) for flow storage while incorporating a random sampling module to generate training data. The off-chip part applies Lie Group Linear Discriminant Analysis (Lie-LDA) to extract key flow features and identify flows with large measurement errors. It then employs a regression model to establish a mapping between counter values and actual flow sizes, refining the measurement results. Experiments on real-world traffic datasets demonstrate that LieCMS reduces the average relative error by 65.63% compared to Count-Min Sketch while using only 30KB of onchip memory, significantly enhancing measurement accuracy.
